scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
SMP is not included in any national catalogue of recommended specifications whose Member State NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
Even though the specification is related to the use and publication of metadata, it is not directly related to the publication of open data. The relation with metadata and its publication is focused on the availability and discoverability of access points and different parties for the exchange of data. 

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
OASIS has defined a clear Technical Committee (hereby TC) process where all the stakeholders involved have the opportunity to participate in the development of the specification development process.

OASIS guideline:
https://www.oasis-open.org/policies-guidelines/casestudies

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was initially developed in 2017 with its initial version 1.0. It was used as the basis for the development of European Specifications and building blocks enhancing the development of public services. However, the version analysed is 2.0 which was released by January 2020. For this reason the specification is not sufficiently mature for its use.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification has been evolved as part of its lifecycle and the previous version has been the basis for European Solutions regarding the development of interoperable services. This fact ensures that the specification reaches a proper market acceptance for its implementation for the development of products and services. 

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
The specification is focused on the discoverability of parties, involving the use of parties metadata and the identification of access points. This field is being developed by public administrations in order to create innovative solutions that work for the enhancement and digitalisation of administrations services. 

An element that can be related to the creation of innovative solutions is the CEF eDelivery Building Block, which can be considered an innovative solution in terms of eGovernment and the relation of Public Administrations with their stakeholders.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

eDelivery: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.

statement:
SMP is maintained by OASIS which is an international community developing open standards. 

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The SMP eases and fosters the discoverability of administrations data or services to others that can be administrations or other stakeholders. Easing this communication the specification allows different parties to discover others' capabilities and information to exchange documents amongst them. This fact increases the visibility of administrations' data and also improves and helps the decision-making processes.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The specification eases the identification of parties capabilities and information to make proper and reliable data exchange between parties. Therefore, by implementing the specification administrative information is clearer and available to every party interested.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

criterion_description: The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
The Service Metadata Publishing describes also the binding of the specification with the REST interfaces for the Service Metadata Publication within a 4-Corner network. Therefore, the specification fosters the availability of interfaces containing information from the different parties involved in a 4-corner network.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

SMP can be implemented in any platform, and it is independent of any technology.

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
Implementing SMP within a eDelivery environment does not hamper the interoperability of systems since SMP is compatible with the scalability of networks and users. The development of these environments can be sustainable and adapt to the user needs without harming implementations.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The specification is a protocol focused on the transaction of data. Even though it is related to data exchange, and it is aimed to ensure the delivery of data, it is not involved in data portability amongst systems fostering the European Public Services.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The implementation of SMP can ease the implementation of the Once-Only principle. Since the specification is related to ease the identification of services and the exchange of data, it can be useful for administrations to reuse and exchange information already available reducing the interactions that users need to do with them.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
The purpose of SMP seems to not be related to fostering the e-accessibility. Moreover, no information regarding this topic has been found to answer positively or negatively to the criterion. Therefore, this criterion does not apply to this specification. 

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
The message returned by a Service Metadata Publisher service is signed using one or more [XML-DSIG1] XML-Signatures. Moreover, the purpose of the specification is to ease and ensure the discoverability of different parties to exchange the desired information. The specification defines a set of requirements regarding the authentication of parties that ensures secure and trustworthy data exchange.

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The SMP is aimed to ease the identification of parties in data exchange. This data exchange can be part of a public service delivered by European Institutions. By easing the discoverability and the connection between parties, the specifications can help and foster the delivery of European Public Services including multilingual ones.

SMP OASIS reference:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
By easing the digital communication SMP is an asset for the simplification and the reduction of administrative burden. The specification fosters the digital exchange of information by enhancing the discoverability of Access points easing the digitalisation of data transactions between administrations and also with other stakeholders like business or citizens.

SMP OASIS reference:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The purpose of SMP seems not to be related to long term preservation of electronic records. Moreover, no information has been found to answer positively or negatively to this criterion. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification. 

SMP OASIS reference:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement: After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the SMP in terms of efficiency or effectiveness.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
SMP is already associated to an EIRA ABB in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, SMP can define the interoperability aspects of the "Service Delivery Model" ABBs of the EIRA Organisational View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
Even though the specification defines conformance criteria, no testing mechanism or tool has been found to validate an SMP implementation. 

The specification:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505000

statement:
There are no Member States recommending SMP in their ICT National Catalogues.
 
CAMSS List of Standards:

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
The SMP has been used as the basis for the development of the eDelivery SMP specification, which in turn is the basis for the implementation of the CEF eDelivery Building Block. The CEF eDelivery Building Block helps public administrations to exchange information with stakeholders (e.g. other administrations, businesses or citizens).

eDelivery SMP specification: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP

CEF eDelivery Building Block: 
https://ec.europa.eu/inea/sites/inea/files/building_block_dsi-introdocument_edelivery_v1_00.pdf

statement:
SMP is not included in any Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications.

criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
The version 1.0 of the specification, which is the previous version of the SMP, was identified within the List ICT technical specifications as reusable, meaning that the Service Metadata Publisher is considered. Even though the version being assessed is not the one identified, it can be considered that the SMP is listed within this repository at European Level.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
Even though the version being assessed is not included in the ICT technical specification in itself, the version 1.0 of the specification was already identified and included within this list of specifications that are compliant with the standardisation regulation for being user in eProcurement. Moreover, the SMP has been the basis for the development of the CEF eDelivery Building Block which helps public administrations to exchange electronic data and documents with other public administrations, businesses and citizens, in an interoperable, secure, reliable and trusted way.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEF eDelivery Building Block:
https://ec.europa.eu/inea/sites/inea/files/building_block_dsi-introdocument_edelivery_v1_00.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
The version being assessed is not included in the ICT technical specification in itself, however the version 1.0 of the specification was already identified and included within this list of specifications that are compliant with the standardisation regulation for being used in eProcurement.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of SMP is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

SMP OASIS reference:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The specification defines how different parties and transactions have to be done in order to allow proper discoverability and data exchanges. Therefore, it is defining organisational requirements for the data transaction between two or more parties.

SMP OASIS reference:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
The SMP specification defines a set of data structures (a data model) that can be followed for proper implementation of the specification that can be used across-sector.

SMP OASIS reference:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Even though the specification is related to the use and publication of metadata, it is not directly related to the publication of open data. The relation with metadata and its publication is focused on the availability and discoverability of access points and different parties for the exchange of data. 

SMP OASIS reference:
https://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v2.0/cs02/bdx-smp-v2.0-cs02.html#_Toc30505009

Five star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
